Detailed Description

Driver for Programmable Interrupt Controller.

The PIC or Programmable Interrupt Controller enables the system to allow/forbid interrupts. By allowing an interrupt the PIC defines which interrupts are handled by the system. It is important that interrupts will only be handled if the interrupt has been allowed and if the handling of interrupts is enabled (see class CPU).

Member Function Documentation

void PIC::ack (  ) 

acknowledge the handling of a pending interrupt

Acknowledge an occured interrupt. This tells the PIC that his last interrupt has been handled. This Method has to be called before the cpu is allowed to handle any new interrupts. If an interrupt is not acknowledged the same interrupt is called again and again.

Definition at line 99 of file pic.cc.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void PIC::allow ( Interrupts  interrupt  ) 

allow a specific hardware interrupt

Enables the system to handle interrupts of the specified device using the PIC. To enable the handling of any interrupt CPU::enable_int() has to be called first.

Parameters:
interrupt number of interrupt that will be allowed

forbid a specific hardware interrupt

Disables an interrupt useing the PIC.
